value.value:
# Tool Calling & Templating

### Tool-calling is an important part of any realtime application. In this example, we'll be creating a configurable vision-based tool-calling system to make our video input feed programmable.

nodes.description: A comment node for adding notes and documentation to your graph

value.value: ### We flush our video Sliding Window into our LLM context every 5000ms.

value.value:
### You can manually or programmatically update this string node to change what item our system prompt and tool-call are looking for.

### *** You must Remix the app to make changes

value.value:
### We've created a tool call to watch for when an item is presented to the AI model.

### We can then edit the JSON Schema our tool call emits on activation.

value.value: ### In this case, we are emitting a simple boolean property called `item_detected` and rendering it as a string. We can send this in a web request, or use it in other parts of our workflow.
